devdoc.author: Karen Suen
devdoc.details: Basic security are implemented here to prevent unauthorised parties from tampering with listings and transactions. In practice, this proxy contract should have sole ownership of the low level contracts to ensure only this contract can invoke their methods by manually implementing ownership checks or using the OpenZeppelin Ownable contract. To reduce gas cost, business logic is implemented in the client app.

buyListing(uint256).details: Sender of this function purchases the given listing and sends the correct amount of funds to be held in escrow. This function assumes the correct amount of funds are sent and the listing exists.

params._listingId: The listing id to purchase with funds

confirmItemReceived(uint256).details: Updates a transaction to confirmed status, triggering release of buyer's purchase funds to the seller

params._listingId: The id of listing to update

constructor.details: Constructor initialises instances of low-level storage contracts for this proxy contract.

createListing(uint256,string,string,stri.details: Create a new listing in the marketplace and notifies client with the new listing id through event. Sender of this function is assumed to be the seller of the listing.

params._desc: The string description of the listing
params._title: The string title of the listing and item for sale

retrieveListing(uint256).details: Returns all information about a listing through through an event.

params._id: The id of listing to retrieve

devdoc.title: A proxy contract for interacting with low-level contracts

userdoc.notice: All client interactions should use this contract to modify the state of the marketplace (create or modify listings and transactions)
